intro: Coccoloba orizabae, commonly known as the Orizaba coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
